docs.title: Carter's Stellar Towers Docs (Dev)
docs.text:
Welcome to the documentation for Carter's Stellar Towers!

This site includes:

  • Mechanics
  • Errors
  • Tower Config

You can navigate using the sidebar or links above.

docs.text:

docs.title: Static Mechanics
docs.text:
• IcyPart
  • ParticleEmitter
  • SignPart

docs.title: BalloonPart
docs.text: The BalloonPart attaches a balloon to a player or other character that moves them in a certain direction with a set velocity.

docs.title: Config
docs.text:
• BalloonColor: Sets the balloon's color. Default is [0, 255, 127]
  • DismountOnJump: Disconnects the balloon attached to the local player if this is set on the balloon attached to them. Default is true
  • Duration: The length of time before the balloon is automatically disconnected from a character. Setting it to 0 or lower never removes it from a character. Default is 5
  • MoveDir: The direction in which the Velocity is applied. Must be a unit vector. Default is 0, 1, 0

Tip

MoveDir is automatically cast to a unit vector

  • RandomColor: Decides if a random color is applied instead of BalloonColor. Default is false
  • RestrictPlayer: Limits the activation to only characters with a player character. Default is true
  • RopeLength: Length of the rope that attaches the player to the balloon. Default is 1.5
  • Velocity: The velocity that is applied to the balloon to make it move. It is applied in the direction of the MoveDir

docs.title: Tags
docs.text: • BalloonPart

docs.title: ConveyorPart
docs.text: Has a linear velocity in the look vector with a specified velocity.

docs.title: Config
docs.text: • Speed: The speed of the velocity that the part has. Default is 10

docs.title: Tags
docs.text: • ConveryorPart

docs.title: DamagePart
docs.text:
Deals a set amount of damage on contact with the local player character.

Attention

Only applies to the local player to prevent health update conflicts.

docs.title: Config
docs.text: • Damage: The amount of damage applied to the local player character on touch

docs.title: Tags
docs.text: • DamagePart

docs.title: HealPart
docs.text:
Heals a specified amount of health. Can heal multiple times after a cooldown.

Attention

Only applies to the local player to prevent health update conflicts.

docs.title: Config
docs.text:
• Cooldown: How long the cooldown before healing again lasts. Default is 1
  • Health: How much health is healed after the cooldown is finished. Default is 25

docs.title: Tags
docs.text: • HealPart

docs.title: InstaKillPart
docs.text:
A part that kills the player that touches it with their max health. Non-configurable.

Attention

Only applies to the local player to prevent health update conflicts.

docs.title: Tags
docs.text: • InstaKillPart

docs.title: LightingChanger
docs.text: A part that changes the lighting settings locally when touched by the local player character.

docs.title: Config
docs.text:
• Ambient: The lighting hue applied to areas that are occluded from the sky. Default is [255, 255, 255]
  • Brightness: The intensity of the illumination in the place. Default is 0
  • ClockTime: A numerical representation (in hours) of the current time of day used by Lighting. Default is 0
  • ColorShift_Bottom: The hue represented in light reflected in the opposite surfaces to those facing the sun or moon. Default is [255, 255, 255]
  • ColorShift_Top: The hue represented in light reflected from surfaces facing the sun or moon. Default is [255, 255, 255]
  • EnvironmentDiffuseScale: Ambient light that is derived from the environment. Default is 0
  • EnvironmentSpecularScale: Specular light derived from environment. Default is 0
  • ExposureCompensation: This property determines the exposure compensation amount which applies a bias to the exposure level of the scene prior to the tonemap step. Default is 0
  • FadeDuration: The length of time it takes for the tween to be completed. Default is 3
  • FogColor: Color of the Lighting fog. Default is [120, 120, 120]
  • FogEnd: Depth from the current camera that the fog will be fully opaque. Default is 100000
  • FogStart: Depth from the current camera that the fog will begin to show. Default is 0
  • GeographicLatitude: The geographic latitude, in degrees, of the scene, influencing the result of Lighting time on the position of the sun and moon. Default is 0
  • OutdoorAmbient: The lighting hue applied to outside areas. Default is [255, 255, 255]
  • Reset: Property that forces the lighting to reset to it's original properties. All other properties are ignored if this is set to true. Default is false

docs.title: Tags
docs.text: • LightingChanger

docs.title: PlayerModifierPart
docs.text:
Note

This is not featured in the tower kit currently. Sit tight!

Changes the speed or jump power of a player.

docs.title: Resetting Properties
docs.text: The Reset attribute resets your speed to the default walk speed of 16 and jump power of 50. It resets all stats.

docs.title: Resetting Single Stat
docs.text: To reset a single stat, AffectsSpeed or AffectsJump attribute must be set to true for what you want to reset and change it to the default.

docs.title: Config
docs.text:
• AffectsJump: Decides if the modifier will affect the jump power of a player. Default is false
  • AffectsSpeed: Decides if the modifier will affect the walk speed of a player. Default is true
  • JumpPower: The jump power applied to a player if AffectsJump is true. Default is 50
  • WalkSpeed: The walk speed applied to a player if AffectsSpeed is true. Default is 16
  • FadeDuration: The length of the tween that changes the player's settings. Default is 3
  • Duration: The amount of time that the effect lasts. If it is less than or equal to 0, the effect is infinite. Default is 0
  • Reset: Property that forces the walk speed and jump power of a player to reset to it's original properties. All other properties are ignored if this is set to true. Default is false

docs.title: Tags
docs.text: • PlayerModifier

docs.title: PoisonPart
docs.text:
A part that deals repetitive damage at a set interval as long as a player is touching it.

Attention

Only applies to the local player to prevent health update conflicts.

docs.title: Config
docs.text:
• Damage: How much damage is dealt at each interval. Default is 3
  • Rate: How long before damage is dealt again. Default is 0.5

docs.title: Tags
docs.text: • PoisonPart

docs.title: SitPart
docs.text: A part that forces a character to go into a sitting state.

docs.title: Config
docs.text: None

docs.title: Tags
docs.text: • SitPart

docs.title: StandPart
docs.text: A part that forces a player to stand up if they are sitting.

docs.title: Config
docs.text: None

docs.title: Tags
docs.text:
• UnSitPart

Deprecation Warning

UnSitPart will be replaced by StandPart soon.

  • StandPart

docs.title: TeleportPart
docs.text:
Note

The part has a distinction in the tower kit as TeleportStart and TeleportEnd.

TeleportStart

TeleportEnd

docs.title: Config
docs.text:
• Id: The teleport id that links teleport parts together. Default is 102
  • IsSafetyNet: Denotes if a teleport part is a safety net. Does nothing but forces the part to be invisible. Default is false
  • IsStart: Denotes if the teleport part is the entrance or exit of a link. When IsStart is set to true, players cannot come out of that specific teleport part. Default is false
  • Offset: The offset added to the player when it exits a teleport. Default is 0, 10, 0
  • Thunder: Denotes if a teleport will make a thunder sound when exiting. Default is false
  • Type: Decides what can be teleported. Humanoid is the only working option. Default is Humanoid

docs.title: Tags
docs.text: • TeleportPart

docs.title: VirusPart
docs.text:
A part that deals repetitive damage at a set interval as long even after a player has touched it.

Attention

Only applies to the local player to prevent health update conflicts.

docs.title: Config
docs.text:
• Damage: The amount of damage that is dealt. Default is 3
  • Length: The amount of time after the player has stopped touching it it will deal damage. Default is 5
  • Rate: How long before damage is dealt again. Default is 0.5

docs.title: Tags
docs.text: • VirusPart

docs.title: IcyPart
docs.text: A part that has low friction. It does not have any configuration as the friction is set in CustomPhysicalProperties.

docs.title: Tags
docs.text: • None

docs.title: ParticleEmitter
docs.text: A part that has a particle emitter inside of it. It has no config. The emitter can be configured in Part.Attachment.ParticleEmitter.

docs.title: SignPart
docs.text: A part that has a SurfaceGui to display GUIs. That is about it.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Welcome to the official documentation of Carter's Stellar Towers! This documentation will tell you everything you need to know about our tower kit.

docs.title: Installation Instructions
docs.text: The kit is a place under the game's creator. It can be found as an unclopylocked template place.
